description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Research for Decision Makers (RDM) activity will support implementation research on priority health areas, provide advisory services to the Government of Bangladesh (GOB) to guide health policy and strategy formulation, and build health-sector research capacity. USAID will also benefit through programmatic guidance from the findings of RDM research. With FY 2020 funds, RDM will continue the implementation of research studies on family planning, maternal and newborn health, nutrition, and tuberculosis with a focus on health system strengthening. RDM will also conduct secondary analysis of Bangladesh's Demographic and Health Survey and develop policy briefs to guide the country's health program. RDM will disseminate the results of the studies and analyses through various channels, which will provide the evidence needed to inform policy and programmatic decision-making by key stakeholders. Through RDM, USAID will build local research capacity and expand the evidence base to inform future public health policies in Bangladesh. By assisting the GOB and USAID to translate evidence into policy, RDM will contribute to reducing child and maternal mortality, fertility rates, and tuberculosis incidence rate, while improving the nutritional status of children.This Activity will support the U.S. National Security Strategy Pillar IV, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goal Two, and the U.S. government's mission objective of improved health status in Bangladesh.
